NEW PAGE 89
PLANNING BOARD'S WRITTEN RECOMMENDATION and CONSISTENCY STATEMENT TO THE TOWN
COUNCIL TO APPROVE THE TEXT AMENDMENTS PRESENTED TO THE PLANNING BOARD ON July 12,
2022 REGULAR MEETING
WHEREAS, the Zoning Administrator introduced the proposed text amendments which are as follows:
1.
Article 4 Section 401-Definitions: The following definition shall be added as section 401.52.1
Light Industrial- The indoor manufacturing, processing, fabrication, assembly, treatment,
and packaging of products, and incidental storage, sales and distribution of such products,
which does not produce noise, odors, vibration, hazardous waste materials, or particulate
that will disturb or endanger neighboring properties.
2.
Article 6 Section 601-Table of Uses. Add Light Industrial as a permitted with standards use
in the C-2, C-3 and I-1 districts. Not a permitted use in R-10 or C-1.
3.
Additional standards
Article 7 Section 718.1- Light Industrial
1. Points of ingress and egress shall be located a sufficient distance from road intersections
to minimize traffic hazard, inconvenience and congestion. Additionally, each
development shall have a minimum of two such points of ingress and egress to facilitate
the safe flow of traffic.
2.
No open storage of dangerous or offensive items such as uncured hides, explosives, oils,
gasoline, etc.
4.
Section 800. Design Standards
Design guidelines and the procedures for review and approval are consistent with adopted
Town of Burnsville Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021, and previously adopted plans. These
plans have identified community appearance and quality design standards as being
necessary and beneficial to the town's local economy and the overall quality of life within
the community. These design standards and procedures are applicable only for multi-family
(more than 4 units), commercial, and business uses. Single family residential uses are
exempt from the requirements of this Article. The adoption and enactment of these
standards shall be construed to amend or repeal any other similar or previously existing
provisions.
5.
Section 602. Table of dimensional requirements
WHEREAS, pursuant to NCGS 160D-604 "the planning board shall make a written recommendation
regarding adoption of the regulation to the governing board." "Subsequent to initial adoption of a
zoning regulation, all proposed amendments to the zoning regulation or zoning map shall be submitted

NEW PAGE 90
to the planning board for review and comment. If no written report is received from the planning board
within 30 days of referral of the amendment to that board, the governing board may act on the
amendment without the planning board report."; and
WHEREAS, the Planning Board has reviewed and commented on whether the proposed amendment is
consistent with any plan or plans for land use in the Town of Burnsville and has provided written
recommendation to the Town Council concerning the same; and
WHEREAS, the Planning Board finds these amendments are consistent with the above referenced plans
and that these changes are reasonable and will serve the public interest because of the following:
The proposed amendments are consistent with the recommendations (1, 6, 13, and 19 on pages
59, 60, 61 and 62) of the Burnsville Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021 in that these
amendments will reduce minimum lot sizes, facilitate commercial development and expand
definitions contained in the current zoning ordinance.
WHEREAS, the Planning Board recommends to the Burnsville Town Council the following as to the
proposed amendments:
NOW, THEREFORE, THE BURNSVILLE PLANNING BOARD HEREBY RECOMENDS AS FOLLOWS:
1. The Planning Board recommends that the Burnsville Town Council approve the proposed text
amendments to the Zoning Ordinance of the Town of Burnsville as presented above.
2. The Burnsville Planning Board finds that the above text amendment recommendations
are
consistent or
are not consistent with the Town of Burnsville's Comprehensive Land Use
Plan.
Read, approved and adopted this the 12thay July, 2022

NEW PAGE 83
ORDINANCE NO. 2022.08.11.02
ORDINANCE AMENDING THE TEXT OF THE ZONING ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN OF BURNSVILLE,
THE ZONING ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN OF BURNSVILLE, NORTH CAROLINA
WHEREAS, the Town has proposed text amendments to the Burnsville Zoning Ordinance for the
following articles:
1.
Article 4 Section 401-Definitions: The following definition shall be added as section
401.52.1 Light Industrial- The indoor manufacturing, processing, fabrication,
assembly, treatment, and packaging of products, and incidental storage, sales and
distribution of such products, which does not produce noise, odors, vibration,
hazardous waste materials, or particulate that will disturb or endanger neighboring
properties.
2.
Article 6 Section 601-Table of Uses. Add Light Industrial as a permitted with
standards use in the C-2, C-3 and I-1 districts. Not a permitted use in R-10 or C-1.
3.
Additional standards
Article 7 Section 718.1- Light Industrial
1. Points of ingress and egress shall be located a sufficient distance from road
intersections to minimize traffic hazard, inconvenience and congestion.
Additionally, each development shall have a minimum of two such points of
ingress and egress to facilitate the safe flow of traffic.
2. No open storage of dangerous or offensive items such as uncured hides,
explosives, oils, gasoline, etc.
4.
Section 800. Design Standards
Design guidelines and the procedures for review and approval are consistent with
adopted Town of Burnsville Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021, and previously
adopted plans. These plans have identified community appearance and quality
design standards as being necessary and beneficial to the town's local economy and
the overall quality of life within the community. These design standards and
procedures are applicable only for multi-family (more than 4 units), commercial, and
business uses. Single family residential uses are exempt from the requirements of
this Article. The adoption and enactment of these standards shall be construed to
amend or repeal any other similar or previously existing provisions.
5.
Section 602. Table of dimensional requirements

NEW PAGE 84
WHEREAS, pursuant to NCGS 160D-601; 160D-604 and the provisions of the Town of Burnsville
Zoning Ordinance adopted June 3, 2021, the Town Council may amend its development
regulations after review, comment and recommendation by the Burnsville Planning Board and
holding a public hearing regarding the amendment as well as determining whether the
amendment is consistent with any comprehensive plan that has been adopted by Town Council
and reasonable and in the best interest of the public; and
WHEREAS, the Burnsville Planning Board reviewed the proposed amendment at its regular
business meeting on July 12, 2022 and recommended approval of the text amendment by a
vote of 5 to 0; and
WHEREAS, the Planning Board found the amendment to be consistent with the Burnsville
Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021 to wit the proposed amendments align with
Comprehensive Plan recommendations 1, 6, 13 and 19 and will reduce minimum lot sizes,
facilitate commercial development, and expand the definitions contained in the current zoning
ordinance to include potential commercial uses; and
WHEREAS, the Burnsville Town Council held a properly noticed public hearing at a special
meeting on August 11, 2022; and
WHEREAS, Council has reviewed the written recommendation of the Burnsville Planning Board,
heard public comment, and discussed the value and reasonableness of the proposed
amendments.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE BURNSVILLE TOWN COUNCIL THAT:
That Burnsville Zoning Ordinance be amended as the follows:
1. Article 4 Section 401-Definitions: The following definition shall be added as section
401.52.1 Light Industrial- The indoor manufacturing, processing, fabrication, assembly,
treatment, and packaging of products, and incidental storage, sales and distribution of
such products, which does not produce noise, odors, vibration, hazardous waste
materials, or particulate that will disturb or endanger neighboring properties.
2. Article 6 Section 601-Table of Uses. Add Light Industrial as a permitted with standards
use in the C-2, C-3 and I-1 districts. Not a permitted use in R-10 or C-1.

NEW PAGE 85
3. Additional standards
Article 7 Section 718.1- Light Industrial
a. Points of ingress and egress shall be located a sufficient distance from road
intersections to minimize traffic hazard, inconvenience and congestion. Additionally,
each development shall have a minimum of two such points of ingress and egress to
facilitate the safe flow of traffic.
b. No open storage of dangerous or offensive items including, but not limited to,
uncured hides, explosives, oils, gasoline, noxious or dangerous chemicals, waste,
garbage etc.
4. Section 800. Design Standards
Design guidelines and the procedures for review and approval are consistent with
adopted Town of Burnsville Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021, and previously adopted
plans. These plans have identified community appearance and quality design standards
as being necessary and beneficial to the town's local economy and the overall quality of
life within the community. These design standards and procedures are applicable only
for multi-family (more than 4 units), commercial, and business uses. Single family
residential uses are exempt from the requirements of this Article. The adoption and
enactment of these standards shall be construed to amend or repeal any other similar
or previously existing provisions.
5.
Section 602. Table of dimensional requirements
6. The Town Council has reviewed the written recommendations of the Planning Board
and finds the amendments to be consistent with the Burnsville Comprehensive Land Use
Plan 2021, to wit the proposed amendments align with Comprehensive Plan
recommendations 1, 6, 13 and 19 and will reduce minimum lot sizes, facilitate
commercial development, and expand the definitions contained in the current zoning
ordinance to include potential commercial uses and is reasonable, will be beneficial and
not be detrimental to property owners in the Town and the public.

NEW PAGE 84
WHEREAS, pursuant to NCGS 160D-601; 160D-604 and the provisions of the Town of Burnsville
Zoning Ordinance adopted June 3, 2021, the Town Council may amend its development
regulations after review, comment and recommendation by the Burnsville Planning Board and
holding a public hearing regarding the amendment as well as determining whether the
amendment is consistent with any comprehensive plan that has been adopted by Town Council
and reasonable and in the best interest of the public; and
WHEREAS, the Burnsville Planning Board reviewed the proposed amendment at its regular
business meeting on July 12, 2022 and recommended approval of the text amendment by a
vote of 5 to 0; and
WHEREAS, the Planning Board found the amendment to be consistent with the Burnsville
Comprehensive Land Use Plan 2021 to wit the proposed amendments align with
Comprehensive Plan recommendations 1, 6, 13 and 19 and will reduce minimum lot sizes,
facilitate commercial development, and expand the definitions contained in the current zoning
ordinance to include potential commercial uses; and
WHEREAS, the Burnsville Town Council held a properly noticed public hearing at a special
meeting on August 11, 2022; and
WHEREAS, Council has reviewed the written recommendation of the Burnsville Planning Board,
heard public comment, and discussed the value and reasonableness of the proposed
amendments.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE BURNSVILLE TOWN COUNCIL THAT:
That Burnsville Zoning Ordinance be amended as the follows:
1. Article 4 Section 401-Definitions: The following definition shall be added as section
401.52.1 Light Industrial- The indoor manufacturing, processing, fabrication, assembly,
treatment, and packaging of products, and incidental storage, sales and distribution of
such products, which does not produce noise, odors, vibration, hazardous waste
materials, or particulate that will disturb or endanger neighboring properties.
2. Article 6 Section 601-Table of Uses. Add Light Industrial as a permitted with standards
use in the C-2, C-3 and I-1 districts. Not a permitted use in R-10 or C-1.
